alert.note: Alert for Giles; Lawrence; Lewis; Marshall; Maury (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 11:51AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Lewis, southwestern Marshall, northeastern Lawrence, southern Maury and northern Giles Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1151 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mount Pleasant to 6 miles northwest of Pulaski. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lawrenceburg, Pulaski, Mount Pleasant, Cornersville, Ethridge, Lynnville, Frankewing, Culleoka, Hampshire and I-65 East Of Columbia. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 14 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
